Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.adt.threesum

Class TwoSumWithCalipers

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.adt.threesum.TwoSumWithCalipers
All Implemented Interfaces:
TwoSum
public class TwoSumWithCalipers extends Object implements TwoSum
The TwoSumWithCalipers class implements the TwoSum interface to find all pairs of integers in a sorted array such that their sum is zero. It uses the "calipers" technique, which employs two pointers moving towards each other to efficiently compute the result in a sorted input.

  • Method Details

    • getPairs

      public Pair[] getPairs()
      Retrieves an array of unique Pair objects that are derived from a combination of sorted and caliper-based operations on an integer array. The method ensures that the pairs are distinct and naturally ordered.
      Specified by:
      getPairs in interface TwoSum
      Returns:
      an array of Pair objects representing distinct pairs, sorted based on their natural ordering.

    • calipers

      public static List<Pair> calipers(int[] a, Function<Pair,Integer> function)
      Finds and returns a list of Pair objects that satisfy a given condition defined by the specified function. This method uses the "calipers" technique to efficiently identify pairs from a sorted input array.
      Parameters:
      a - a sorted array of integers from which pairs are to be selected.
      function - a functional interface that takes a Pair as input and returns an Integer indicating how to adjust the pointers based on the condition. A return value of 0 indicates that the condition is satisfied by the pair, a negative value causes the left pointer to advance, and a positive value causes the right pointer to retreat.
      Returns:
      a list of Pair objects that satisfy the given Function<Pair, Integer> condition.
